item.description:
This folder contains routes that use MCAP (i.e., platform-native) IDs for resource updates. These IDs will always be UUIDs.

Resources in this folder follow a typical REST resource access pattern of:

- Creating a new resource with POST
    
- Updating a resource with PUT
    
- Retrieving a resource with GET
    
- Deleting a resource with DELETE

item.name: Bring-Your-Own ID Routes
Create/Update View (Integrator) - Set Thermal and Masks

item.description:
This folder contains routes that use "bring-your-own" IDs supplied by the integration partner for resource access. These IDs can typically be any client-supplied value but must be URL encoded if they appear in an HTTP path. Note that values of "null" and "undefined" are technically allowed to be used as integrator IDs, though we advise against integration partners doing that.

Resources in this folder follow a typical REST resource access pattern of:

- Creating/replacing a resource with PUT
    
- Retrieving a resource with GET
    
- Deleting a resource with DELETE

item.name: Scenarios

formdata.fileNotInWorkingDirectoryWarning: This file isn't in your working directory. Teammates you share this request with won't be able to use this file. To make collaboration easier you can setup your working directory in Settings.

item.description:
This folder was created to demonstrate (and test) various basic scenarios for different types of analytics. Each capability has its own folder underneath this one, and requests in each folder are meant to be sent "top down" to the server.

These scenarios use the "bring-your-own" ID style because it's more consistent when maintaining the Postman collection.
